definition: instruction/admonition
to teach/to train/to admonish/instruction (from superiors)/teachings/rule
old variant of 詞|词[ci2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: I have more understanding than the elders, for I obey your precepts.
sentences.chinese: 我比年老的更明白，因我守了你的训词。

sentences.english: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
sentences.chinese: 就是那些遵守他的约，记念他的训词而遵行的人。

sentences.english: How I long for your precepts!
They almost wiped me from the earth, but I have not forsaken your precepts.
sentences.chinese: 他们几乎把我从世上灭绝，但我没有离弃你的训词。

sentences.english: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.
sentences.chinese: 他们几乎把我从世上灭绝，但我没有离弃你的训词。

sentences.english: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我明白你的训词，我就思想你的奇事。

sentences.english: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.
sentences.chinese: 我比年老的更明白，因我守了你的训词。

sentences.english: Let me understand the teaching of your precepts; then I will meditate on your wonders.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我明白你的训词，我就思想你的奇事。

sentences.english: 8The precepts of the Lord are right, giving joy to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华的训词正直，能快活人心。

definition: order/instruction
Central Military Committee (CMC)
People's Armed Police
Xi Jinping (1953-), PRC politician, General Secretary of the CCP from 2012, president of the PRC from 2013
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
to swear an oath (of office)/to make a vow
oath/pledge
president (title of the head of state of China and several other nations)
political commissar (during Russian and Chinese communist revolutions)
the (communist) party and the army together (idiom)
(military) march-past
(PRC) Central Military Commission
pinyin: Zhong1 yang1 Jun1 shi4 Wei3 yuan2 hui4

definition: all-army/all-military

the Three Rules of Discipline and Eight Points for Attention, a military doctrine issued in 1928 by Mao Zedong for the Red Army, which included a number of injunctions demanding high standards of behavior and respect for civilians during wartime
pinyin: San1 Da4 Ji4 lu:4 Ba1 Xiang4 Zhu4 yi4

definition: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, abbr. for 中國共產黨中央委員會|中国共产党中央委员会[Zhong1 guo2 Gong4 chan3 dang3 Zhong1 yang1 Wei3 yuan2 hui4]
to read out loud to an audience/a prepared speech (e.g. to a party conference)
